repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Second Adaptable Program Loan
            (APL) for the National Highway Asset Management Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the Second
            Adaptable Program Loan (APL) for the National Highway Asset
            Management Project for Argentina was rated moderately
            satifactory. The risk to dvelopment outcome was moderate;
            the bank performance was satisfactory; and the
            borrower's performance was moderately satisfactory. The
            objectives of the Project are: (a) to further preserve the
            Non-Concessioned National Road Network, through the
            expansion of CREMA Contracts for said network; and (b) to
            further strengthen the National Highways Directorate's
            road sector management capacity. No formal revision of the
            original Project Development Objectives was made during
            project implementation. Other significant changes made
            during project implementation include the following: (a) the
            closing date of the project was extended twice during
            project implementation; (b) the project was first
            restructured in order to accommodate the need to introduce
            in the Loan Agreement specific clauses on safeguard policies
            that were not considered applicable in the original
            documents; (c) partly because of the high inflation in the
            Argentine economy since 2003; and (d) some minor
            reallocations of funds among Categories of the Loan were
            deemed necessary and executed through a second
            restructuration of the project. The following key lessons
            were learned during the execution of the Loan: 1) this
            project fell victim, once again, of a scope of tasks not
            fully committed to by a client;  2) the policy of
            independent technical audits during project implementation
            proved to be extremely valuable and should be widely
            institutionalized for this type of interventions; 3) the
            assessment done by the World Bank of use of Rehabilitation
            and Maintenance Contract (Contrato de Recuperación y
            Mantenimiento, CREMA) in Argentina found that the overall
            cost effectiveness of these type of contracts in comparison
            to traditional ad-measurement or input contracts is 24
            percent; 4) one additional advantage of the CREMA system
            that is rarely mentioned and yet became, once again,
            apparent during project execution, is that it allows
            reasonably swift disbursement of Bank's funds, since
            payments are not linked to time-consuming measurements and
            testing as is the case in traditional inputs-based
            contracting systems.

repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Second Adaptable Program Loan
            (APL) for National Highway Asset Management Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall purpose of the Second
            Adaptable Program Loan (APL) for National Highway Asset
            Management Project for Argentina is to further develop and
            implement an efficient road network management strategy,
            bringing about the necessary resources to preserve the
            national road network in the long term. The reallocation is
            necessary because some bidding processes (purchase of VC and
            Weigh-in-Motion WIM equipment) could not take place because
            of current conditions and restrictions in the country
            regarding imported equipment. All funds allocated to goods
            are therefore reallocated towards the Performance-based
            Rehabilitation and Maintenance Contracts (CREMA) component
            under category 1 (b). Another reallocation is the one
            related to consultants' services. At project design it
            was envisaged to hire consultants to design bridges, but
            during project implementation it was decided that studies
            will be carried out in-house. Proceeds were also reallocated
            towards category 1(b). Finally, the pilot corridor for road
            safety was delayed (mainly because of delays in reaching the
            final design), it will be bid with local funds. Proceeds
            were reallocated towards category 1(b). As a result, the
            allocation to CREMAs (category 1 (b)) increased from
            US$251.25 to US$281.5 million (12 percent increase).

Argentina - Second Adaptable

repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Second Adaptable Program Loan
            (APL) for National Highway Asset Management Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Second Adaptable
            Program Loan (APL) for the National Highway Asset Management
            Project for Argentina are: (a) to further preserve the
            Non-Concessioned National Road Network, through the
            expansion of Performance-based Rehabilitation and
            Maintenance Contracts (CREMA) contracts for said network;
            and (b) to further strengthen National Highway Directorate
            (DNV's) road sector management capacity. The
            restructuring will trigger the following six safeguards
            policies: natural habitats, forests, pest management,
            physical cultural resources, indigenous peoples, and
            involuntary resettlement. Additionally, by approval of the
            Country Director, the restructuring: (i) supports a minor
            reallocation of the loan proceeds; and (ii) extends by 18
            months the closing date of the project, from December 31,
            2011 to June 30, 2013, to allow for completion of planned
            project activities.

repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Second APL for National Highway
            Asset Management Project : resettlement policy framework

abstracts.cdata!:
The Asset Management Program of the
            National Highway Directorate aims to gradually build a
            strategy for effective management of the road network,
            generating the resources necessary to preserve the national
            network in the long run. Its specific objectives are: (i)
            preserve the condition of vital road assets, through the
            gradual expansion of levels of service contracts for the
            rehabilitation and maintenance of the paved, and (ii)
            strengthen road sector management through the execution of a
            renewal program aimed at revitalizing the role of the
            National Highways in the sector. The objective of the
            Framework Resettlement Policy is to clarify the principles,
            rules and procedures to be applied to projects prepared as
            part of Asset Management Program National Highway and
            require expropriation of land or relocation of people. The
            provisions of the Framework will guide the preparation of
            Resettlement Plan; the same shall be submitted to the Bank
            for approval after the availability of specific information
            on planned works. The Framework Resettlement Policy will
            apply to all cases in which the program works construction
            would necessitate the extension of the work area, thus
            causing the following impacts: (i) relocation or loss of
            housing, (ii) loss of land or other economic assets, and
            (iii) loss of income sources or means of subsistence,
            whether those affected must move to another place or not.

display_title.display_title:
Argentina - Second APL for
            National Highway Asset Management Project : resettlement
            policy framework : Marco de Políticas de Reasentamiento
